newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek C/A surplus falls to $41 mln in August.
newsitem.headline: Greek C/A surplus falls to $41 mln in August.

text.p: Greece's current account surplus fell to a provisional $41 million in August from $113.8 million in August 1995, the Bank of Greece said.
For January-August, the current account balance showed a deficit widening to $3.619 billion from $2.147 billion in the same 1995 period, the central bank said in a statement.
The trade deficit increased to $1.231 billion in August from $1.179 billion in August 1995. The cumulative trade deficit rose 5.4 percent year-on-year to $11.818 billion in January-August.
Foreign exchange reserves increased to $16.450 billion in August from $16.202 billion a year earlier, it said. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
